abstract: Google, Microsoft, Nokia and Hewlett-Packard are developing products that show a desire to expand beyond their respective core businesses.
snippet: Google, Microsoft, Nokia and Hewlett-Packard are developing products that show a desire to expand beyond their respective core businesses.
lead_paragraph: Just as Apple’s iPhone shook up a complacent cellphone industry, the company’s iPad is provoking PC makers — and non-PC makers — to fight back with new devices.

headline.main: After iPad, Rivals Offer Variations on a Theme
headline.print_headline: After iPad, Rivals Offer Variations on a Theme

byline.original: By Ashlee Vance and Nick Bilton

abstract: Apple’s plunge into the advertising market announced last week gave Google a big boost in arguing for regulators to approve its acquisition of mobile advertising leader AdMob, Google C.E.O. Eric Schmidt said Sunday.
snippet: Apple’s plunge into the advertising market announced last week gave Google a big boost in arguing for regulators to approve its acquisition of mobile advertising leader AdMob, Google C.E.O. Eric Schmidt said Sunday.
lead_paragraph: Apple‘s plunge into the advertising market announced last week gave Google a big boost in arguing for regulators to approve its acquisition of mobile advertising leader AdMob, Google’s chief executive,  Eric E. Schmidt, said Sunday.

headline.main: Google’s Schmidt Says Apple Helped AdMob Deal

abstract: The Russian government, hoping to diversify its economy away from oil, is building the first new scientific city since the collapse of the Soviet Union, The New York Times writes. Even more improbably, it is modeled, officials say, on Silicon Valley.
snippet: The Russian government, hoping to diversify its economy away from oil, is building the first new scientific city since the collapse of the Soviet Union, The New York Times writes. Even more improbably, it is modeled, officials say, on Silicon Vall...
lead_paragraph: Around the time that Apple Computer was making it big in California, Andrey Shtorkh was getting a first-hand look at the Soviet approach to high tech: he guarded the fence keeping scientists inside Sverdlovsk-45, one of the country’s secret scientific cities, deep in the Ural Mountains.

headline.main: Innovation, by Order of the Kremlin

abstract: Outside developers of applications for Twitter are beginning to fear that the micro-blogger could transform overnight from generous benefactor to arch competitor to their start-ups, The New York Times writes.
snippet: Outside developers of applications for Twitter are beginning to fear that the micro-blogger could transform overnight from generous benefactor to arch competitor to their start-ups, The New York Times writes.
lead_paragraph: It was the beginning of a beautiful relationship.

headline.main: Tensions Rise for Twitter and App Developers

abstract: Google is said to be hard at work on its own version of an iPad killer that will allow the use of Adobe’s Flash video and games.
snippet: Google is said to be hard at work on its own version of an iPad killer that will allow the use of Adobe’s Flash video and games.
lead_paragraph: As Ashlee Vance and I report in a Monday article, Hewlett-Packard, Acer, Microsoft and a suite of other companies are hard at work on products that they hope will be iPad killers.

headline.main: A Google Tablet Could Be Good News for Adobe
